title: Will we actually stop climate change and global warming? - Quora

response.answer_text: I learned about global warming in 3rd grade, which would have been 1974–75. At that time, it was a hypothesis. By the time I was in college and heard about it again an educational setting, it was about 1991. It was accepted science by then. that was 29 years ago. We’ve done next-to-nothing. Exxon Mobile knew about climate change in the 70s, as shown by their own documents. They have documents showing they saw global warming as helping them, since the arctic would be free of ice (allowing drilling) more months of the year. Yet they paid big money to promote the myth that global warming was a myth. (This is well known.) President Trump has pulled the US out of the Paris climate accord, an agreement that was signed on by every other country in the world. To have every country in the world agree to something is unprecedented. Even if we pulled out all the stops, it would be hard going. We aren’t going to pull out all the stops. We just won’t. No, we will not be able to overcome global warming/climate change. What will happen is that the disasters, civil wars, refugee movement will cost taxpayers more and more and more. There will be unrest, wars, people fighting over water, then over food. Countries will be taken over by authoritarians as poeple become more and more afraid of the effect of refugees coming to their country (not unfounded). The unrest, wars, poverty, resource scarcity will cause more and more problems until the unrest will be greater than anything we’ve seen before. In the United States, as the western United States starts to fall, that is when we will hit the downward spiral that we won’t be able to recover from. The plastic pollution will exacerbate the situation, and in fact might end up causing more problems sort-term than climate change. The best hope is that most people in the world die in a short time period. I hope that I am wrong. I hope it doesn’t happen, doesn’t have to happen. The untold suffering keeps me awake at night. But it might the best for humanity, the earth, and all the species if that happens.

I don’t see why we all can’t just demand cheap clean energy. We’re going to need it to power ten billion people at high standards, anyways. I’m trying to save money to invest in Tesla, however, I’m forced to continue within the dino paradigm (got to drive to work). Here’s proof that deniers are WRONG. GHG induced radiative forcing is a thing that’s just as real as any other physics. Once they learn the physics, they’ll start saying “but it’s still ok to warm the planet” (in fact, they are already doing so, using the way it was hundreds of millions of years ago as a pretence)! Why is it that deniers accept the fact that scientists know what the sun is made out of, or that Pangea was real, but not the extra radiative forcing (global warming)? For the same reason, we will probably not solve the challenge and humanity will succumb to economic collapse into an overheated biosphere. All we need is primary clean energy. Solar, wind, nuclear, you know, ALL of them! Batteries are getting cheaper and better, too. Here’s a link about CHEAP SOLAR! 8 Countries (Besides the US) With Solar Under $25 per Megawatt-Hour We’ve the solutions but not the will.
